definitions.definition: to keep a person, an animal or a plant alive and healthy with food, etc.

examples.text: All the children were well nourished and in good physical condition.
Most plants are nourished by water drawn up through their roots.
a lotion containing almond extract to nourish and revitalize the skin

definitions.definition: to allow a feeling, an idea, etc. to develop or grow stronger

examples.text: By investing in education, we nourish the talents of our children.
There were hopes that the talks would nourish the fragile growth of good relations between the two countries.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old French noriss-, lengthened stem of norir, from Latin nutrire ‘feed, cherish’.
